dag

Class Amr

  • java.lang.Object
    • dag.Amr

  • public class Amr
extends Object
    Class to represent an Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) graph. The actual graph is represented by an instance of DirectedGraph.

      void prepareForTesting(edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger tagger)
      Prepares an AMR graph for training by doing the following: Assign POS tags to the vertices of the AMR graph that are not PropBank framesets Convert the AMR graph to a tree by applying DELETE-REENTRANCE transitions (see DirectedGraph.convertToTree()) Merge named entities into a single entity (see mergeNameEntities(Vertex)) Merge verbalized concepts into a single entity (see deverbalize(Vertex)) Remove :wiki edges from the AMR graph (see Vertex.removeWikiTags()) Annotate each vertex with its mode (see annotateModes(Vertex))
      void prepareForTraining(edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger tagger)
      Prepares an AMR graph for training by doing the following: Assign POS tags to the reference realization and the vertices of the AMR graph Refine the given alignments through several handwritten rules Convert the AMR graph to a tree by applying DELETE-REENTRANCE transitions (see DirectedGraph.convertToTree()) Merge named entities into a single entity (see mergeNameEntities(Vertex)) Merge verbalized concepts into a single entity (see deverbalize(Vertex)) Remove :wiki edges from the AMR graph (see Vertex.removeWikiTags()) Annotate each vertex with its mode (see annotateModes(Vertex)) Calculate the span of each vertex contained within the AMR graph (see calculateSpan())

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public static void setUp()
                  throws IOException
        Static method to load some maps required for the preparation of AMR graphs as done by prepare(List, MaxentTagger, boolean). This method must be called before calling any of prepare(List, MaxentTagger, boolean), prepareForTraining(MaxentTagger), prepareForTesting(MaxentTagger).
        Throws:
        IOException

      • posFromString

        public void posFromString(String posString)
        Loads the POS tags of this AMR's reference sentence from a tab-separated string
        Parameters:
        posString - the tab-separated string of POS tags

      • prepareForTraining

        public void prepareForTraining(edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger tagger)
        Prepares an AMR graph for training by doing the following:
        1. Assign POS tags to the reference realization and the vertices of the AMR graph
        2. Refine the given alignments through several handwritten rules
        3. Convert the AMR graph to a tree by applying DELETE-REENTRANCE transitions (see DirectedGraph.convertToTree())
        4. Merge named entities into a single entity (see mergeNameEntities(Vertex))
        5. Merge verbalized concepts into a single entity (see deverbalize(Vertex))
        6. Remove :wiki edges from the AMR graph (see Vertex.removeWikiTags())
        7. Annotate each vertex with its mode (see annotateModes(Vertex))
        8. Calculate the span of each vertex contained within the AMR graph (see calculateSpan())
        Parameters:
        tagger - a maximum entropy POS tagger

      • prepareForTesting

        public void prepareForTesting(edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger tagger)
        Prepares an AMR graph for training by doing the following:
        1. Assign POS tags to the vertices of the AMR graph that are not PropBank framesets
        2. Convert the AMR graph to a tree by applying DELETE-REENTRANCE transitions (see DirectedGraph.convertToTree())
        3. Merge named entities into a single entity (see mergeNameEntities(Vertex))
        4. Merge verbalized concepts into a single entity (see deverbalize(Vertex))
        5. Remove :wiki edges from the AMR graph (see Vertex.removeWikiTags())
        6. Annotate each vertex with its mode (see annotateModes(Vertex))
        Parameters:
        tagger - a maximum entropy POS tagger

      • merge

        public void merge(Vertex master,
                  Vertex slave,
                  String instLabel,
                  String pos)
        Implementation of the MERGE transition described in the thesis.
        Parameters:
        master - the parent vertex
        slave - the child vertex
        instLabel - the instance label of the resulting merged vertex
        pos - the POS tag of the resulting merged vertex

      • swap

        public void swap(Vertex parent,
                 Vertex child)
        Implementation of the SWAP transition described in the thesis.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent vertex
        child - the child vertex

      • deverbalize

        public void deverbalize(Vertex v)
        Checks for verbalized constructions like (person (:ARG1-of develop-02)) and deterministically merges them into a single node (developer). The required deverbalization map is extracted from http://amr.isi.edu/download/lists/verbalization-list-v1.06.txt
        Parameters:
        v - the vertex to check

      • getRealizationPOS

        public void getRealizationPOS(Vertex v,
                              edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger tagger)
        Determines the POS tag of the realization of some vertex v. To this end, all words to which v is aligned are checked and the POS tag of the word that resembles v the most (by comparing prefixes) is chosen for v. If no such prefix mach can be found, a default POS tag is assigned by a maximum entropy tagger.
        Parameters:
        v - the vertex
        tagger - the maxent tagger

      • calculateSpan

        public void calculateSpan()
        Calculates the span of every vertex in the AMR graph as defined in the thesis.

      • getSpan

        public Span getSpan(Vertex v)
        Calculates the span of a vertex v and every vertex in the v-subgraph of this AMR graph.
        Parameters:
        v - the vertex to calculate the spanf or
        Returns:
        the span of v

      • findBySentence

        public static Amr findBySentence(String beginning,
                                 Collection<Amr> amrs)
        Helper function to find the first AMR graph within a collection of graphs whose reference realization starts with the specified beginning.
        Parameters:
        beginning - the string with which the searched AMR graphs realization begins
        amrs - the collection of AMR graphs
        Returns:
        the first matching AMR graph or null if no such graph is found

      • prepare

        public static void prepare(List<Amr> amrs,
                           edu.stanford.nlp.tagger.maxent.MaxentTagger tagger,
                           boolean forTesting)
        Prepares a list of AMR graphs for either training or testing by calling either prepareForTraining(MaxentTagger) or prepareForTesting(MaxentTagger).
        Parameters:
        amrs - the list of AMRs to prepare
        tagger - a maximum entropy POS tagger
        forTesting - whether the AMR graphs should be prepared for testing (forTesting = true) or for training (forTesting = false)

      • yield

        public String yield(PartialTransitionFunction ptf)
        Returns the partial yield of this AMR graph given a partial transition function as defined in the thesis. The yield is represented by a string of space-separated words.
        Parameters:
        ptf - the partial transition function
        Returns:
        the partial yield of this AMR graph

      • yieldList

        public List<AlignedWord> yieldList(PartialTransitionFunction ptf)
        Returns the partial yield of this AMR graph given a partial transition function as defined in the thesis. The yield is represented by a list of AlignedWord instances.
        Parameters:
        ptf - the partial transition function
        Returns:
        the partial yield of this AMR graph

      • yieldList

        public List<AlignedWord> yieldList(Vertex vertex,
                                   PartialTransitionFunction ptf)
        Returns the partial yield of the vertex-subgraph of this AMR graph given a partial transition function as defined in the thesis. The yield is represented by a list of AlignedWord instances.
        Parameters:
        vertex - the root of the subgraph to consider
        ptf - the partial transition function
        Returns:
        the partial yield of the vertex-subgraph of this AMR graph
